I have pumped while driving, in a cafe, at a party. Honestly so good. I think the negative reviews are mainly just user error/not realising one of the parts has been damaged. They have a good tutorial on their website to check if it’s all working right. It also is quiet compared to every other pump - don’t know what people are expecting! It’s completely undetectable In any room that isn’t completely silent. Would highly recommend! The app is also brilliant (although you have to stay upright for an accurate reading so don’t stop it at a slant) being able to control the setting is also fab and it’s so much gentler than other pumps while still getting just as much milk.:)

Absolute waste of money!!                                    Would not recommend at all for multiple reasons! Completely style over substance - does not pump out as much as an electric pump and therefore breastS aren’t emptied properly which is dangerous (I ended up with mastitis and then breast abscesses). I have had 2 as both broke (one even broke after 2 days) and waiting for a 3rd replacement (I am only 3 months into the warranty!). Leaks as soon as you aren’t vertical. Amount pumped and amount app states you have pumped are always wildly different. Claims it’s silent, it’s not. Battery life short (only does 1.5pump Sessions max). For the price, I would expect MUCH more from a pump.

Don't waste your money.  NOT recommended by lactation consultant.                                    I bought this for my wife who was excited to be using a state of the art portable breast pump.  The Elvie did not live up to the expectations which is set in marketing material.  My wife's lactation consultant explained that is it not pumping efficiently and recommended switching to a Mandela pump which we hired as they are expensive.  The difference is like night and day.  Just before we hired the Mandela the Elvie stopped working, it wouldn't charge and it has been a nightmare dealing with firstly oxygenboutique who we purchased through.  They simply refused any refund or replacement.  Then dealing with Elvie who refer us back to Oxygenboutique.  The issue is now with my credit card company to deal with.  This product is potentially dangerous, stick with tried and tested breast pumps for optimum breast health and to express in a healthy way.  DON't WASTE YOUR MONEY!

Don’t waste your money!!                                    I am sad to have to write this as initially I thought the idea of the breast pump was fantastic! Not long after receiving the pump it stopped working completely. Elvie dealt with the issues and admitted it was faulty. They sent me a replacement quickly and I was happy with the service. Unfortunately, the replacement soon began to leak, the battery lost power quickly, the app is not accurate and the suction was not constant. As a first time mum having to go back to work soon after having my son I needed a pump I could rely on. I can’t stress the frustration this pump has caused. Whilst trying the various troubleshoots I had to go back to work and drive back and forth to feed my son, so you can imagine this situation was not ideal!! I have tried all the various troubleshoot options but to no avail. Quite frankly I have lost all faith in this product and have had to go back to the good old fashioned manual which has never let me down. I contacted Elvie directly who said I would have to request for a refund via the third party (little nukins) for a refund. They have then told me that it is down to Elvie as they hold the funds and because I do not wish to have ANOTHER replacement they will not refund the money.I think this service is appalling, with neither parties accepting responsibility. Before Elvie reply offering a replacement please don’t bother, I don’t wish for it to be replaced I would like to be refunded for your faulty product! I only wish I had read these reviews before purchasing!!!

Terrible experience                                    Terrible experience - confused as to how there are so many good reviews elsewhere. This Company does not allow opened returns BEWARE ! Purchased as my baby had tongue tie and had to pump and combination feed. Thought it would be dream come true as regular pumping instead of feeding my baby was very upsetting. Slick design and packaging, however the pump was no where near strong enough to get even 10ml. This along with the heat that comes off the motor is uncomfortable to say the least. It’s also not silent and clearly visible due to the white light on the front. Contacted Elvie but was told was that returns are not allowed due to it being an “intimate item”. Would not have purchased if I’d known the non returns policy. Don’t buy unless you’re sure this is the right product for you as it’s a lot of money to lose plus still having to buy another pump. Would only recommend Medela pumps like they use in the NHS. (Replacement parts are not what I needed at the time I just wanted my money back for something not fit for purpose) Mainly so I could buy another pump. Good reliable brands like Medela offer this.

Cannot recommend the Elvie product                                    Cannot recommend the Elvie product.  The product leaks, you cant bend over, it dies after 30 minutes and has no suction. It barely produces 2oz. I contacted the company trying to get a refund but they have yet to respond. The amount of money spent on this sub par product could have gone to other things for my baby.

Extremely Disappointing!                                    I was extremely disappointed with the Elvie breast pump after eagerly awaiting its arrival. My baby wouldn't breast feed due to spending a week in NICU and being bottle fed. I made the decision to still exclusively give him breast milk and after using a couple of traditional pumps round the clock thought that Elvie sounded like a dream being hands free. Due to he branding and the price I didn't research reviews assuming that it would be great.Unfortunately, after several attempts of trying I just could not pump half as much milk as from my other pumps. Furthermore, the product leaked if I didn't sit still. It wouldn't have been a big problem for me, but another thing that it didn't live up to that was it wasn't silent. Very luckily, as I paid through Paypal and I received a full refund - something which I understand the company won't issue if you pay directly.
